definition: to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither

sentences.english: She hands me my change and looks at me, waiting for me to respond.
sentences.chinese: 她把找零遞給我，然後看着我，等待我的反應。

sentences.english: Two tickets and here’s a dollar forty cents change.
sentences.chinese: 這是兩張票以及一美元四十美分的找零。

sentences.english: Keep the change bag design hotel, in the end is about how to design it?
sentences.chinese: 酒店找零袋的設計，到底是談如何設計呢？

sentences.english: Pick up our ticket and any change.
sentences.chinese: 拿好你的車票以及找零即可。

sentences.english: We only have RMB for change .
sentences.chinese: 我們只能以人民幣找零。

sentences.english: If you gave him a penny for his thoughts, you 'd get change.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用一分錢買他的想法，你還能拿到找零。

sentences.english: Please feel free to add your “money finding” tip as well, I look forward to your comments.
sentences.chinese: 請隨意添加您的“找零”帖子，期待着您的意見。

sentences.english: Okay. Can you change a thousand-dollar bill?
sentences.chinese: 好的。千元美鈔你能找零嗎？

sentences.english: This is time-consuming for staff and shopper alike.
sentences.chinese: 對於超市員工和購物者來說，找零都很耗時。

sentences.english: The first is to do with the physical task of giving change.
sentences.chinese: 第一種與找零這項體力活有關。

sentences.english: She had to make the hot dogs and give change -- all very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 她必須迅速的做好熱狗並給人找零零錢。

definition: to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
to use a credit card (or swipe card, smart card etc)
to pay a sum of money/payment
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
